key.name: navigation-bar-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable the navigation bar feature or not.

key.name: navigation-bar-ignore-touch-mode
key.summary: If true, the navigation bar will be shown even if the Shell is not in touch mode. If false, the navigation bar will be shown only in touch mode.

key.name: navigation-bar-monitor
key.summary: When set, and the chosen monitor is connected, the navigation bar is shown on that monitor instead of the built-in monitor. When the chosen monitor is not connected, no navigation bar will be shown.

key.name: navigation-bar-primary-monitor-follows-navbar
key.summary: When enabled, the primary monitor is automatically changed to the monitor the navigation bar is placed on, as long as it's visible.

key.name: navigation-bar-mode
key.summary: Navigation bar mode â€“ whether to use a small gesture navigation bar or a more old school navigation bar with buttons.

key.name: navigation-bar-gestures-reserve-space
key.summary: Whether to reserve space for the navigation bar or overlay it over the work area. This setting has no effect when the navigation bar mode is set to "buttons".

key.name: navigation-bar-gestures-invisible-mode
key.summary: Whether to hide to navigation bar gesture hint entirely.

key.name: navigation-bar-buttons-left
key.summary: Which buttons to show on the left side of the button navigation bar * Available choices are: - "keyboard" - keyboard open button - "workspace-previous" - switch to previous workspace - "workspace-next" - switch to next workspace - "overview" - open overview - "apps" - open apps overview - "back" - navigate back - "spacer" - adds a little space between buttons

key.name: navigation-bar-buttons-middle
key.summary: Which buttons to show in the middle of the button navigation bar * Available choices are: - "keyboard" - keyboard open button - "workspace-previous" - switch to previous workspace - "workspace-next" - switch to next workspace - "overview" - open overview - "apps" - open apps overview - "back" - navigate back - "spacer" - adds a little space between buttons

key.name: navigation-bar-buttons-right
key.summary: Which buttons to show on the right side of the button navigation bar * Available choices are: - "keyboard" - keyboard open button - "workspace-previous" - switch to previous workspace - "workspace-next" - switch to next workspace - "overview" - open overview - "apps" - open apps overview - "back" - navigate back - "spacer" - adds a little space between buttons

key.name: overview-gestures-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable the overview gestures feature or not.

key.name: osk-key-popups-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable the OSK key popup feature or not.

key.name: osk-key-popups-duration
key.summary: How long to show the OSK key popups for (in milliseconds).

key.name: osk-gestures-swipe-to-close-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable the swipe-to-close OSK gesture or not.

key.name: osk-gestures-extend-keys-enabled
key.summary: Whether to (virtually, not visibly) extend keys, i.e. allow taps close by an OSK key to also be registered as a key press.

key.name: screen-rotate-utils-floating-screen-rotate-button-enabled
key.summary: Whether to show a floating screen rotate button when Gnome's auto-rotate setting is disabled, and the device is physically rotated. * Note: This has no effect if the device does not have an accelerometer.

key.name: notification-gestures-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable touchscreen gestures for notifications or not.

key.name: virtual-touchpad-enabled
key.summary: Whether to enable the virtual touchpad feature or not.

key.name: preferences-initial-page
key.summary: The initial page to show when the extension preferences are opened the next time.
